column4: hey guys... i've been working with ubuntu for a little while and I have some suggestions that I'd like to make... is the bug list or ubuntu-devel mailing list the appropriate place
I think that the system isn't functioning as it should but I don't think it was developed to do what I think
right now the networks don't register until you log in
they also aren't remembering networks you've logged into before
sleep settings aren't applied prior to login
depends.  If it's a bug, file a bug at bugs.ubuntu.com
you need to be more specific
you might want to join #ubuntu-bugs and discuss it too

it is a poorly worded question ;)... I meant that I would like to pick a location, say $HOME/src/ubuntu, and when I execute apt-get -b source somepackage it puts all the artifacts there such as the downloaded source, resulting debs, etc
just run the command from that directory (cd there first), it extracts things to the current working directory.
thats what I always thought... well at least since flash worked properly on it ;)
yeah, ubuntu will setup flash with nspluginwrapper (has for a while).  I prefer to use the 64bit version adobe put out there though
